title: 114_hr3869
content: The Act titled "State and Local Cyber Protection Act of 2015" mandates coordination between state and local entities with the National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center. The State and Local Coordination on Cybersecurity section of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 amends the national cybersecurity and communications integration center to assist State and local governments in identifying information system vulnerabilities and security protections. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 amends the national cybersecurity center to assist State and local governments in securing information systems and coordinating nationwide efforts for effective implementation of information security tools and resources. The national cybersecurity center assists State and local governments in implementing information security tools, providing training on cybersecurity and privacy, and offering technical assistance upon request. The national cybersecurity center provides operational and technical assistance to State and local governments for implementing information security tools, analyzing data, and conducting targeted evaluations on information systems. They also help in developing policies for coordinating vulnerability disclosures. The national cybersecurity center assists State and local governments in developing policies for coordinating vulnerability disclosures and ensures awareness of information security tools and resources. Training provided includes processes consistent with the Department's Fair Privacy and civil liberties training. The training provided for privacy and civil liberties includes processes that align with the Department's Fair Information Practice Principles. It aims to limit unnecessary information related to cybersecurity risks, minimize impact on privacy and civil liberties, and ensure data integrity. The cybersecurity measures aim to safeguard data integrity, protect privacy and civil liberties, and ensure confidentiality of sensitive information. The national cybersecurity and communications integration center must protect the confidentiality of cyber threat indicators and defensive measures while ensuring constitutional, legal, and privacy protections are observed. Congressional oversight requires reporting on the effectiveness of these activities, including feedback from State and local governments. The House of Representatives passed the information required under this subsection on December 10, 2015. Attest: KAREN L. HAAS, Clerk.
